json.text: Hi, I'm Cami Oetman and this is your AWR360° Moment
I am in Japan standing on Hacksaw Ridge this is where the true story of Desmond
Doss, a Seventh-day Adventist, stood boldly for God and his convictions. He was here
in Okinawa during the bloodiest battle of World War II and saved 75 men
without firing or carrying a gun. As an Army medic he single-handedly evacuated
the wounded from behind enemy lines, braved fire while tending to soldiers and
was even wounded by a grenade, but God preserved his life. Desmond was loyal to
God and is a witness to the whole world what is more important than being loyal
to our Redeemer all through the ages God has had moral heroes and he has them now.
Just like Desmond Doss, AWR listeners from around the world are taking their
stand for Jesus, at all costs, even at the risk of their own life. We must stand up
for all of God's truth and live a life of prayer Bible study and witnessing to
others. Friends, we need a generation of believers who are not ashamed of the
gospel, an army of believers that hate to be lukewarm and will stand on God's holy
word above all else. Friends we need to learn to fight on our knees, there is
limitless power in prayer. Only the Lord knows how many countless lives have been
touched by the testimony of Desmond Doss and the testimonies of AWR listeners.
You too can make an eternal impact on lives today the Holy Spirit is ready to
work through you, just ask. I welcome you to our website
AWR.org, where you can read miracle stories and watch more testimonial
videos. My friends, remember that those who stand for Jesus in these last days,
He will stand for you in the courts of heaven. Just like Desmond's prayer, let us
each pray “please Lord give me just one more.”
This has been your AWR360° Moment.
